![Google map of boat lifts in Bricktown NJ](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20700%20500'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

# Boat lifts IN Bricktown -   IMM Quality Boat Lifts

## **Elevate Your Boating Experience with Our Premium Boat Lifts in Bricktown, New Jersey**

Are you ready to make waves in Bricktown, New Jersey? Discover the secret to effortless, worry-free boating with our cutting-edge Boat Lifts. At the heart of this picturesque coastal community, we bring you the ultimate solution to safeguard your beloved vessels while elevating your maritime experience to new heights.

### **The Ultimate in Waterfront Luxury**

⚓ Say goodbye to the hassle of traditional mooring and hello to the future of waterfront living. Our Boat Lifts offer you the perfect blend of form and function. Picture your boat, yacht, or personal watercraft cradled securely, hovering above the water, ready for your next aquatic adventure.

### **Protect Your Investment**

We understand the investment you’ve made in your aquatic assets, and we’re committed to preserving their value. Our Boat Lifts prevent costly hull damage, osmosis, and corrosion by keeping your boat safely out of the water when you’re not sailing. Say goodbye to unsightly barnacles and tedious maintenance!

### **Superior Craftsmanship**

Crafted with precision and designed for durability, our Boat Lifts are engineered to withstand the harshest coastal conditions. Whether it’s the unforgiving saltwater or fluctuating tides, rest assured that your boat lift will endure, providing years of dependable service.

### **Convenience at Your Fingertips**

Our boat lifts are designed with convenience in mind. With state-of-the-art remote control systems, you can effortlessly lower or raise your vessel with just the push of a button. Spend more time enjoying the open water and less time fussing with ropes and anchors.

### **Customizable Boat Lifts**

We understand that no two boats are alike. That’s why our Boat Lifts come with a range of customization options to suit your unique needs. From size and capacity to design and finish, we ensure that your boat lift seamlessly integrates with your waterfront property.

### **Safety for All**

Safety is our utmost priority. Our Boat Lifts are equipped with advanced safety features to protect you, your loved ones, and your boat. Rest easy, knowing your investment is in good hands.

Join the elite community of boat owners who have discovered the convenience, luxury, and peace of mind that our Boat Lifts offer. Whether you’re a passionate sailor, a weekend boater, or a coastal connoisseur, we have the perfect lift for you. [Get a Quote](https://iqboatlifts.com/boat-lift-quotes/)

## **Dive into a new era of boating with our Boat Lifts in Bricktown, New Jersey.**

[Contact us today](https://iqboatlifts.com/contact/) to learn more about our premium Boat Lifts and elevate your waterfront lifestyle. Don’t miss out on this opportunity to enhance your boating experience – the future of Bricktown boating is here.

## **World’s Best Boat Lifts in Bricktown, New Jersey?**

![Boat Lifts in Bricktown, New Jersey](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201800%201200'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

Bricktown is a township in Ocean County, New Jersey. While the majority of Brick Township is located on the mainland, Ocean Beaches I, II and III are situated on the Barnegat Peninsula, a long, narrow barrier peninsula that separates Barnegat Bay from the Atlantic Ocean. Brick Township Reservoir, with parts located in both Brick and Wall Township, covers 80 acres. Fishing is permitted on the reservoir, which is pumped in from the Metedeconk River. Residents have access to peaceful ponds, creeks, and rivers through private docks and piers. Regardless of where you live in Bricktown, [IMM Quality Boat Lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/about/) understands your historic city’s boatlift requirements and challenges.

IMM Quality Boat Lifts provides [the world’s best boat lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/boats-lifts/) in Brick, NJ. IMM Quality Boat Lifts offers a variety of boat lifts made from marine grade aluminum that are built to last. Backed by more than 35 years of experience in this industry, our patented engineering designs are the most reliable and easy to use boat lifts that you can find. Manufactured locally in our Fort Myers, Florida factory, we are proud to be made in America.

### Order Boat Lifts in Bricktown, NJ

While our lifts are shipped around the world, it is always a comfort to know that we can meet the needs of our customers in the Brick Township area. No matter what type of watercraft you own and what shoreline conditions exist at your home or business, IMM Quality Boat Lifts will build you a lift that perfectly suits your lifestyle. That is why our boat lifts are the preferred choice of discerning customers and have an unsurpassed reputation.

## Rose Key Projects
[Skip to content](https://iqboatlifts.com/the-rose-key-projects/#content "Skip to content")

[Get a Quote](https://iqboatlifts.com/boat-lift-quotes/)

[Call Now 1-800-545-5603](tel:+18005455603)

![Rose Key Satellite Image - IMM Quality Boat Lifts Project](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/rose-key-satelite.jpg)

# The Rose Key Projects

- [January 22, 2021](https://iqboatlifts.com/2021/01/22/)
- [Specialty Projects](https://iqboatlifts.com/specialty-projects/)

Rose Key lies at the center of a privately held archipelago in Monroe County, Florida, located a few miles north of the Ocean Reef Club in Key Largo. The island chain and surrounding waters boast a storied past, from the discovery of Biscayne Bay by Ponce de Leon to the CIA using Rose Key as a safe house and training area. More recently, the popular 1980s TV show, _Miami Vice,_ used Rose Key as a film location. Rose Key was named in honor of Rose Zumpano, a long-time South Florida philanthropist, who loved to share with others the wonders of the Florida Keys.

![The Rose Key Skyway invites guest with a custom built aluminum archway.](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/RoseKeySkyway-Arch-300x168.jpg)

IMM Quality Boat Lifts has been fortunate enough to be involved with many of the island’s marine construction projects. Our very first project involved some of the island’s unique history. The CIA built a [marine railway](https://iqboatlifts.com/marine-railway-lifts/) to launch watercraft into the island’s southern channel and over the years, it had become inoperable. We repaired the concrete structure, supplemented the steel rails with aluminum rails, upgraded the machinery and customized the shuttle to accommodate the Rose Key’s Carolina skiff. These projects were standard fare for a boat lift manufacturer of our size and caliber, but the following projects will highlight the design, engineering and manufacturing capabilities no other boat lift company possesses.

When you have an amazing client like the Zumpano family, you often get asked to take on projects that are outside your normal product line. The family wanted to repair a skyway to provide access from the compound’s center to the southeast tip of their barrier island. Their Rose Key Skyway would cross the horseshoe-shaped canal system that encircles the main island. They wanted a [retractable span](https://iqboatlifts.com/custom-retractable-bridge-on-the-florida-keys/) to cross the canal that would be installed as a seamless part of the Rose Key Skyway.

So, IMM Quality Boat Lifts built them a Vlotburg span and decked it to match the walkway. Below you can see the Vlotburg under construction and a video showing how easy the span is to retract by hand.

![Retractable Bridge Crossing Canal](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/retractable-bridge-in-the-keys-1024x768.jpg)

![YouTube video player](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/mXM1WbAlmIw/hqdefault.jpg)

The Rose Key Skyway was the project that tested our manufacturing capacity. We needed to manufacture thousands of feet of aluminum handrailing. Some of the handrailing was manufactured on an angle to deal with changes in elevation. Below, you can see the Rose Key Skyway under construction, some of the engineered sections, the completed Skyway, and finally, a drone video that highlights the magnitude and scope of the Rose Key Skyway aluminum handrail project.

![Retractable Bridge Side View Above Trees](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/retractable-bridge-side-view-1024x706.jpg)

![Retractable Bridge Concept Planning](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/Retractable-bridge-plans-1024x781.jpg)

![Retractable Bridge Plans Continued](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/Retractable-bridge-plans-2-1024x778.jpg)

![YouTube video player](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/wxkSu2CLhao/hqdefault.jpg)

The Rose Key Skyway was designed to terminate with a gazebo and terminal dock. The family needed railing around the dock, along with some gates. We designed some aluminum columns with a stainless-steel cable railing system to accomplish this project. Below are some photos of an engineered rendering of the gazebo, the gates, and the gazebo under construction.

![Rendering Of Gazebo in Rose Key Project](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/Rendering-of-gazebo-1024x637.jpg)

![Rose Key Project Drawing Of Gazebo](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/Drawing-of-Gazebo-1024x681.jpg)

![Railing Along Gazebo Walkway After Construction](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/Railing-Along-Gazebo-Walkway-1024x781.jpg)

![Final Product Of Rose Key Gazebo Project](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/Final-Product-of-Rose-Key-Projects-1024x814.jpg)

Now, after many months, the work on the Rose Key Skyway is complete! IMM Boat Lifts successfully refurbished the skyway from the center of the Rose Key compound to the dock at the property’s perimeter.

![YouTube video player](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/CliH0Z3tG1w/hqdefault.jpg)

_Feeling inspired by this feat of design, engineering, and manufacturing? Complete our [CONTACT FORM](https://iqboatlifts.com/contact/) or [REQUEST A QUOTE](https://iqboatlifts.com/boat-lift-quotes/), and IMM Quality Boat Lifts will give you a call!_

_**READ MORE**: [IMM Quality Boat Lifts’ Revolutionary Ascension Stair Lift](https://iqboatlifts.com/introducing-the-ascension-stair-lift/)_

_Originally Posted: January 22, 2021_

_Updated: July 9, 2021_

# BOAT LIFTS IN BAYTOWN TX

Are you in search of reliable boat lifts in Baytown, Texas? Look no further. We specialize in providing premium marine lifts designed to safeguard your valuable vessels and elevate your boating experience. With years of experience and a commitment to excellence, we are your trusted source for boat lifts in Baytown.

**Why Choose Our Boat Lifts in Baytown:** Our boat lifts offer numerous advantages for boat owners in Baytown:

**1\. Premium Quality:** We take pride in offering boat lifts built to withstand the challenging marine conditions of Baytown. Our products are crafted using high-quality materials.

**2\. Customized Solutions:** We understand that each boat is unique. That’s why we offer tailor-made boat lift solutions to perfectly accommodate your specific vessel, ensuring a precise fit.

**3\. Expert Installation:** Our team of experienced professionals is dedicated to installing your boat lift with precision and efficiency, providing you with peace of mind.

**4\. Durability and Longevity:** Our boat lifts are engineered for long-term durability, ensuring your investment remains well-protected for years to come.

**5\. Local Expertise:** With our strong presence in Baytown, we possess invaluable knowledge of the local waterways and conditions, making us the go-to choice for boat lifts.

Ready to enhance your boating experience in Baytown, TX? Don’t hesitate to get in touch with us today. Our team is here to answer your inquiries, provide quotes, and assist you in finding the perfect boat lift solution for your needs. [Request a Quote](https://iqboatlifts.com/boat-lift-quotes/)

## **![boat lifts in Baytown, TX](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201024%20891'%3E%3C/svg%3E)Looking for boat lifts in Baytown, TX?**

Recognized as one of the Houston metropolitan area’s biggest cities, Baytown was originally founded in the early 1800s as three separate and distinct towns. Today, those towns have come together to form a mid-sized city of about 85,000 individuals that enjoy life bordering the inlet that leads directly into Tabbs Bay. For fishing and boating enthusiasts, the city offers several locations like Roseland Park and Britton Park where residents can go and enjoy the water. Baytown is also home to several distinct neighborhoods located right on the water like Lakewood and Debruhl. Regardless of where you live in Baytown’s beautiful coast, IMM Quality Boat Lifts understands the coastal city’s boatlift needs.

[IMM Quality Boat Lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/about/) brings the world’s best [boat lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/boats-lifts/) to Baytown, TX. IMM Quality Boat Lifts offers a variety of boat lifts made from marine-grade aluminum that are built to last. Backed by more than 35 years of experience in this industry, our patented engineering designs are the most reliable and easy-to-use boat lifts that you can find. Manufactured locally in our Fort Myers, Florida factory, we are proud to be made in America.

### Order Boat Lifts in Baytown, TX

While our lifts are shipped around the world, it is always a comfort to know that we can meet the needs of our boat lift customers in the Baytown area. No matter what type of watercraft you own and what shoreline conditions exist at your home, IMM Quality Boat Lifts will build you a lift that perfectly suits your needs. That is why our boat lifts are the preferred choice of discerning customers and have an unsurpassed reputation that speaks for itself.

# BOAT LIFTS IN SACO, MAINE -   IMM QUALITY BOAT LIFTS

### **Looking for Boat Lifts in Saco, Maine?**

![Google map of boat lifts in Saco, Maine](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/Boat-Lifts-in-Saco-ME.png)

A town located in a peaceful alcove known as Saco Bay, Saco is perfect for those looking to get an authentic New England small town experience. Founded in June 1972, and with a local population of about 18,000 people, the town offers a charming respite from the everyday commotion of urban living. The local area is a host to all variety of natural amenities like a beautiful beach, forests, bogs, and open grass fields.

Residents and visitors alike enjoy the nearby Saco river through private and public piers or opt to go to one of two waterparks located within the town. Regardless of where you live in Saco’s beautiful coast, [IMM Quality Boat Lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/about/) understands the coastal city’s boatlift needs.

## Boat Lifts in Saco, Maine

IMM Quality Boat Lifts brings [the world’s best boat lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/boats-lifts/) to Saco, ME. IMM Quality Boat Lifts offers a variety of boat lifts made from marine-grade aluminum that are built to last. Backed by more than 35 years of experience in this industry, our patented engineering designs are the most reliable and easy-to-use boat lifts that you can find. Manufactured locally in our Fort Myers, Florida factory, we are proud to be made in America.

While our lifts are shipped around the world, it is always a comfort to know that we can meet the needs of our customers in the Saco area. No matter what type of watercraft you own and what shoreline conditions exist at your home, IMM Quality Boat Lifts will build you a lift that perfectly suits your needs. That is why our boat lifts are the preferred choice of discerning customers and have an unsurpassed reputation that speaks for itself.

![Google map of boat lifts in Boston MA](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20700%20436'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

# Boston's Premier Boat Lifts - Elevate Your Boating Adventure

## **Premier Boat Lifts in Boston, MA**

Are you seeking dependable boat lifts in the vibrant city of Boston, Massachusetts? Your quest has led you to the right place. We specialize in delivering top-of-the-line marine lifts, meticulously designed to protect your treasured vessels and enhance your boating escapades. With a legacy of excellence and an in-depth understanding of Boston’s unique maritime conditions, we proudly stand as your trusted source for boat lifts in the city.

**Why Our Boston Boat Lifts Are Exceptional:** Our boat lifts bring a multitude of benefits to boat owners in Boston:

**1\. Impeccable Craftsmanship:** We take immense pride in offering boat lifts built to withstand the challenging waters of Boston Harbor. Our products are crafted with meticulous attention to detail, utilizing premium materials that guarantee durability.

**2\. Tailored Solutions:** Recognizing the unique characteristics of every watercraft, we provide tailor-made boat lift solutions, ensuring a seamless and precise fit for your specific vessel.

**3\. Installation Expertise:** Our experienced professionals are unwavering in their dedication to installing your boat lift with precision and efficiency, providing you with absolute peace of mind.

**4\. Durability Redefined:** Our boat lifts are designed to shield your investment and provide long-lasting protection for your beloved boats, ensuring you enjoy your boating experience for years to come.

**5\. Local Know-How:** With a deep-rooted presence in Boston, we possess an intimate understanding of the local waterways and conditions, making us the preferred choice for boat lifts among Boston’s boating enthusiasts.

Are you ready to elevate your boating enjoyment in Boston, MA, to new heights? Don’t delay; reach out to us today. Our team eagerly awaits to address your queries, offer personalized quotes, and guide you in discovering the perfect boat lift solution tailored precisely to your unique needs. [Request a Quote](https://iqboatlifts.com/boat-lift-quotes/)

## **Looking for** **Boat Lifts in Boston, MA** **?![Boat Lifts in Boston, MA](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%202560%201692'%3E%3C/svg%3E)**

Boston was founded in 1630 by one of the earliest groups of colonists from England. Known for its rich and historic culture, the city is the heart of the largest metropolitan area in the state of Massachusetts. Boston is home to a vibrant and growing community of intellectuals, investors, students, and entrepreneurs that are spread out over 23 distinct communities.

From the charming cobblestones of Beacon Hill and the revolutionary landmarks of the Freedom Trail, to its iconic universities, Fenway Park, and the financial district, the city has the perfect attraction for everyone. The beautiful neighborhoods of both Allston and Back Bay also border the picturesque Charles River, one of Boston’s three aquatic arteries.

No matter which community you live in the Boston area, [IMM Quality Boat Lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/about/) understands Boston and its aquatic needs. We serve neighborhoods such as:

- Beacon Hill
- Seaport District
- Back Bay
- Fenway & Kenmore
- South End
- North End
- West End
- Charlestown
- West Roxbury

IMM Quality Boat Lifts brings [the world’s best boat lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/boats-lifts/) to Boston, MA. IMM Quality Boat Lifts offers a variety of boat lifts made from marine-grade aluminum that are built to last. Backed by more than 35 years of experience in this industry, our patented engineering designs are the most reliable and easy-to-use boat lifts that you can find. Manufactured in our Fort Myers, Florida factory, we are proud to be made in America.

### Order Boat Lifts in Boston

While our lifts are shipped around the globe, it is always a comfort to know that we can meet the needs of our customers in the Boston area. No matter what type of watercraft you own and what shoreline conditions exist at your home, IMM Quality Boat Lifts will build you a lift that perfectly suits your needs. That is why our boat lifts are the preferred choice of discerning customers and have an unsurpassed reputation that speaks for itself.

## Better Boat Lift Beams
[Skip to content](https://iqboatlifts.com/building-better-top-beams/#content "Skip to content")

[Get a Quote](https://iqboatlifts.com/boat-lift-quotes/)

[Call Now 1-800-545-5603](tel:+18005455603)

![boat lift with stepped top beam holds large white boat in front of waterfront home](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/01-IMM-Quality-Boat-Lift-with-Stepped-Top-Beam-Holds-Large-White-Boat-in-front-of-waterfront-home.jpg)

# Building Better Top Beams

- [August 19, 2022](https://iqboatlifts.com/2022/08/19/)
- [Boat Lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/boat-lifts/), [Specialty Projects](https://iqboatlifts.com/specialty-projects/)

At [IMM Quality Boat Lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/), our skilled engineers have developed a way of building better top beams for our boat lifts.

The original designs for boat lift top beams put the drive pipe and bearing blocks on top of the structure. This simple design was easy to manufacture with “off-the-shelf” parts. However, there was a risk that fingers and clothing could easily get caught in the exposed drive pipe and cable during lift operation. After a series of accidents, many municipalities have banned this design due to safety concerns.

![IMM Quality boat lift that shows exposed drive pipe secured to top of the structure](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/02-IMM-Quality-boat-lift-that-shows-exposed-drive-pipe-secured-to-top-of-the-structure.jpg)This boat lift shows exposed drive pipe secured to top of the structure.

To address this safety problem, most manufacturers have now put the drive pipe inside the top beam structure. The top beams of typical boat lifts are made from C-channel and flat-wall bearing blocks. The bearing blocks are welded to the side of the C-channel and support the full weight of the boat.

![Inferior c channel top beam design](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/03-Inferior-C-channel-top-beam-design.jpg)An inferior C-channel top beam design

But what happens if there is a bad weld that breaks? There is no structure to support the weight, and your boat crashes into the water. The C-channel top beams are obviously not an ideal design, but they are the cheapest and easiest way to get the job done. But do you really want the safety of your boat relying upon this flawed design?

![IMM Quality: Building Better Top Beams](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/fex2-kysKGI/hqdefault.jpg)

IMM Quality Boat Lift’s superior manufacturing capabilities allow our engineers the flexibility to make better designs because our machines can make any metal part. We are not limited to “off-the-shelf” parts. Instead, we make all of our parts in-house using our extensive array of CNC machines. Furthermore, we are willing to take our designs directly to the aluminum foundries and mills, where we have paid to have them make custom foundry dies. The aluminum mills use these dies to make custom aluminum extrusions that we machine into some of the parts for our boat lifts.

![IMM Quality custom extrusion for the boat lift stepped wall bearing blocks](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/04-IMM-Quality-custom-extrusion-for-the-boat-lift-stepped-wall-bearing-blocks.jpg)Featuring a custom extrusion for the “stepped” wall bearing blocks

IMM Quality Boat Lifts has a much better solution for boat lift top beams. Our engineers designed a “stepped” channel and paired it with a “stepped”-wall bearing block. The “stepped” walls improve boat lift top beams in several ways:

![Diagram that shows positioning of stepped bearing block](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/05-Diagram-that-shows-positioning-of-stepped-bearing-block.jpg)

First, the step increases the strength and rigidity of the channel. Think about holding a piece of paper by its edge. The paper does not stand out, but flops over because the thin paper is not rigid enough to support the weight. Now make a “Z” fold down the length of the paper to make a step. The paper will now easily stand out its full length when you hold it by the edge. These same physical principles apply to the top beam channel when we add the step to it, and we now have a channel with improved strength and rigidity.

![Diagram that shows hand holding flat paper and stepped paper](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/06-Diagram-that-show-hand-holding-flat-paper-and-stepped-paper.jpg)Adding a step to a flat material increases its strength and rigidity.

Secondly, the steps greatly simplify the alignment of the bearing blocks within the top beam channel. By having the steps of the bearing block and top beam channel fit perfectly together like two pieces of a puzzle, we have eliminated the human error that can occur when the welder measures the vertical position of each bearing block. This feature makes sure that the bearing blocks are always perfectly aligned and that you won’t have to try to force your drive pipe through bearing blocks that are out of position.

![Stepped channel top beam showing stepped wall bearing blocks welded into perfect alignment by imm quality boat lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/07-Stepped-channel-top-beam-showing-stepped-wall-bearing-blocks-welded-into-perfect-alignment-by-IMM-Quality-Boat-LIfts.jpg)

Most important of all, the step provides physical support to the bearing block. The step in the channel creates a ledge upon which the shelf of the “stepped”-wall bearing block sits. Although it took more effort to design these patented custom extrusions, and although they cost more than an “off-the-shelf” solution, the effort is well worth it because nothing is more important than your safety. Even if a weld were to fail in the IMM-designed top beam, there is still aluminum structure to support the weight of your boat. Sometimes accidents happen, and when they do, you will be glad to have a boat lift engineered with redundant back-up safety features.

Exceptionally engineered and thoroughly tested, IMM Quality Boat Lifts are _**Built for a Lifetime**_.

![IMM Quality boat lift holds large blue and white boat securely with stepped top beam](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/IMM-Quality-Boat-Lift-holds-large-blue-and-white-boat-securely-with-stepped-top-beam.jpg)

# Boat lifts IN Dover -   IMM Quality Boat Lifts

## **Looking for Boat Lifts in Dover, New Jersey?**

![Google map of boat lifts in Dover NJ](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/Boat-Lifts-in-Dover-NJ-Map.jpg)

A vibrant community with a rich, wonderful history and an even more exciting future, Dover is a town in Morris County, New Jersey. It is located on the Rockaway River. With easy train access directly to and from New York, Dover is an active community with monthly events and an ever-growing gathering of fantastic restaurants. Dover is a hidden gem that’s been polished to a sheen. Residents have access to peaceful ponds, creeks and rivers through private docks and piers. Regardless of where you live in Dover, [IMM Quality Boat Lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/about/) understands your historic city’s boatlift requirements and challenges.

IMM Quality Boat Lifts brings the world’s best boat lifts to Dover, NJ. IMM Quality Boat Lifts offers [a variety of boat lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/boats-lifts/) made from marine-grade aluminum that are built to last. Backed by more than 35 years of experience in this industry, our patented engineering designs are the most reliable and easy to use boat lifts that you can find. Manufactured locally in our Fort Myers, Florida factory, we are proud to be made in America.

### Order Boat Lifts in Dover, NJ

While our lifts are shipped around the world, it is always a comfort to know that we can meet the needs of our customers in the Dover area. No matter what type of watercraft you own and what shoreline conditions exist at your home or business, IMM Quality Boat Lifts will build you a lift that perfectly suits your lifestyle. That is why our boat lifts are the preferred choice of discerning customers and have an unsurpassed reputation.

## Elevator Boat Lift Guide
[Skip to content](https://iqboatlifts.com/how-does-an-elevator-lift-work/#content "Skip to content")

[Get a Quote](https://iqboatlifts.com/boat-lift-quotes/)

[Call Now 1-800-545-5603](tel:+18005455603)

![This Platinum elevator boat lift raises a white and blue boat from the water at a residential home](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/IMM-IMG-0643-Lum-e1628174802349.jpg)

# How Does an Elevator Boat Lift Work?

- [June 9, 2022](https://iqboatlifts.com/2022/06/09/)
- [Boat Lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/boat-lifts/), [General Interest](https://iqboatlifts.com/general-interest/)

Have you ever wondered, “How does an elevator lift work?” An elevator boat lift functions much like other standard boat lift systems, in that it removes and securely stores your boat above the water. At the same time, an elevator system has a uniquely specialized design.

In a recent blog article, IMM Quality Boat Lifts examined the basic parts and function of a boat lift, explaining how it works and why many boat owners view this as a wise investment. Check out [our informative piece](https://iqboatlifts.com/what-is-a-boat-lift-your-questions-answered) about standard features (cable, pulleys, nylatron wheels, auto stop, remote control etc.) on lift systems to learn more.

## Why Buy an Elevator Boat Lift?

Are you wondering, “Why buy an elevator boat lift?” First, be sure to analyze your needs. You need to know the make and model of your watercraft or yacht as well as the water conditions (water depth, tidal fluctuation, bottom conditions, etc.) at your installation location. It pays to take the time to explore your options in consultation with a knowledgeable marine contractor. While it may sound like a cliché, not all lifts are created equal. Each type serves its unique purpose.

### **Make Boating Easier with an Elevator Boat Lift**

Elevator lifts are a good option for locations in which the installation of pilings is difficult or prohibited.  This may be due to the limited water rights of the property, crowded waterways, and canals, or because hard bottom conditions make the driving of pilings prohibitively expensive. Elevator boat lifts don’t require pilings for structural support and can accommodate larger vessels up to 40,000 lbs if the dock/seawall structure is strong enough. Elevator lifts provide convenience, protect boats, and add value to waterfront property.

### **Safety and Convenience with Elevator Boat Lifts**

Thinking of installing an elevator boat lift at your waterfront property? [Investing in an elevator lift](https://iqboatlifts.com/elevator-lifts/) offers you a number of advantages. This system provides safe and easy access to the water, allowing you to launch and dock your vessel with a single push of a button. Even in narrow canals, elevator lifts can safely maneuver your boat in and out of the water. With this type of system, you’ll enjoy a perfect fit for any vessel size – plus all the convenience and safety of using elevator technology. [Contact](https://iqboatlifts.com/contact/) IMM Quality Boat Lifts today to learn more about elevator boat lifts and [view our gallery of styles](https://iqboatlifts.com/current-boat-lift-styles/) and [installations](https://iqboatlifts.com/installation-instructions/).

## **How Do Elevator Boat Lifts Differ?**

![IMM Quality walkboard and platinum elevator boat lift at waterfront home](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/IMM-walkboard-Elevator-copy2X-New-Lum.jpg)

### **Our Different Elevator**

As you can see, the system minimizes the amount of support structure that is visible above the deck height. Many homeowners prefer this less obtrusive style of boat lift because it provides a more open view of their waterfront property. To view more photos of IMM Quality elevator boat lifts, [click here](https://iqboatlifts.com/current-boat-lift-styles/elevator-lifts-gallery) to browse our online gallery of current styles.



![This Alumavator elevator lift raises a white and blue covered boat from the water](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/IMM-Vator-8ELV-Lum.jpg)

### **Rails**

An elevator system differs from a standard one in a few key ways. Instead of a top beam supported by pilings, it uses rails (I-beam tracks) supported by your dock or seawall. These rails may be mounted vertically or at an angle, depending on your needs. One end of the rail is driven into the seabed while the other is attached to the dock with mounting brackets and track bracing. You should consult a knowledgeable marine contractor to confirm that your dock structure is capable of supporting the load created by the elevator system and to determine the best angle of installation and the required length of the rails.

### **Powerheads**

Elevator lifts have two powerheads that attach to the top of each rail. The powerheads consist of the drive system (gearing and motor) under a protective cover that is coupled to a grooved aluminum cable winder. These powerheads pull the carriage up and lower the carriage down the rails using stainless steel cables. Put simply, it is like a train (carriage) riding on rails.

### ![Elevator lifts Powerheads](https://iqboatlifts.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/elevator-superlift-1_page-0001.jpg)**Powerhead Drive Systems**

For more information on our different lift drive systems, please visit the following pages-

**[Alumavator Elevator Boat Lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/elevator-lifts/alumavator-elevator-lift)**, This high-performing chain lift drive offers an economical option. IMM Quality’s select elevator boat lift model includes many free special features that would otherwise be considered optional upgrades by other dealers.

![Elevator Alumavator Lift | IMM Quality Boat Lifts](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/aRrSZJlbOvs/hqdefault.jpg)

[**Platinum Elevator Boat Lifts**,](https://iqboatlifts.com/elevator-lifts/platinum-elevator-lift) This maintenance-free elevator boat lift uses a direct drive and offers an array of special features that make it easy and convenient to head for open waters from any setting.

![Platinum Elevator Boat Lift  by IMM Quality Boat Lifts](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/o-omLoT0gLA/hqdefault.jpg)

[**Superlift Elevator Boat Lifts**,](https://iqboatlifts.com/elevator-lifts/superlift-elevator-lift) Originally designed for commercial marinas, this rugged, industrial-duty gearless elevator boat lift system offers the fastest, most efficient lift on the market for discerning boaters.

![Elevator Superlift Boat Lift by IMM Quality Boat Lifts](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/f7Tqh6y31hE/hqdefault.jpg)

### **Carriage Construction**

Elevator lifts use a carriage constructed of two “L” shaped arms connected by two aluminum bunks and cross bracing. The carriage has wheels that ride along the top surface of the I-beam track as well as the underside of the same I-beam flange.



IMM Quality Boat Lifts gussets our elevator boat lift “L” shaped arms with one-inch thick billet aluminum plates. Why are our gusset plates so much thicker than the competition’s? Because our gusset plates have CNC-machined channels cut into them that secure the upper and lower flanges of the I-beams that form the “L” shaped arms of the carriage.

Fitted together in this way, the gusset plate reinforces the I-beam joint and provides mechanical support, so that the lift is not relying solely on the strength of welded construction. Furthermore, this innovative approach guarantees the correct alignment of the elevator carriage parts in all three dimensions, fixing the proper angles for the arms and eliminating excess stress on the joint. No more cock-eyed, out-of-square elevator carriages.

## **The Most Innovative Elevator Boat Lift Design**

At [IMM Quality Boat Lifts](https://iqboatlifts.com/about), we bring more than 40 years of experience and knowledge in manufacturing three elevator boat lift models, accessories, technological innovations, and design. Our engineering team constantly makes design improvements to offer stronger and more durable lifts than any other manufacturer in the industry.

## **Get the Most Out of Your Boating Experience**

This patented innovation revolutionized our industry. It increased the strength and durability of IMM Quality’s elevator boat lifts, beyond what our competitors can offer, so that we may confidently claim that we have the strongest elevator arm joints in the industry.

If you would like to explore an elevator boat lift for your home or marina, complete our [CONTACT FORM](https://iqboatlifts.com/contact) or [REQUEST A QUOTE](https://iqboatlifts.com/boat-lift-quotes) and we’ll give you a call to tell you what sets IMM Quality Boat Lifts apart from other manufacturers!

**READ MORE:** [**Custom Boat Lifts & Accessories Make It Easier to Access Your Boat with IMM Quality**](https://iqboatlifts.com/custom-boat-lifts-accessories-make-it-easier-to-access-your-boat-with-imm-quality)

## Frequently Asked Question (FAQs) on Elevator Boat Lift

What is an elevator boat lift and how does it work?

An elevator boat lift functions by lifting and securely storing your boat above the water, similar to other boat lift systems. However, it uses a specialized design with rails supported by your dock or seawall, allowing the boat to be raised and lowered with a carriage system that moves along these rails.

Why should I consider buying an elevator boat lift?

Elevator boat lifts are ideal for locations where installing pilings is difficult or prohibited due to factors like water rights, crowded waterways, or hard bottom conditions. They do not require pilings for structural support and can handle larger vessels, making them a versatile option for different marine environments.

What are the key features of an elevator boat lift?

Key features of elevator boat lifts typically include cable systems, pulleys, nylatron wheels, auto stop capabilities, and remote control operation. These components work together to provide a smooth and efficient lift process, enhancing convenience and safety for boat owners.

How do elevator boat lifts differ from standard boat lifts?

Unlike standard lifts that often rely on a top beam supported by pilings, elevator lifts use rails (I-beam tracks) that can be mounted vertically or at an angle, directly supported by the dock or seawall. This setup minimizes the visible support structure, offering a less obtrusive appearance and preserving the view of waterfront properties.

What should I consider when installing an elevator boat lift?

It is important to know the specifications of your boat and the conditions at your installation site, such as water depth and tidal fluctuations. Consulting with a knowledgeable marine contractor is essential to ensure your dock can support the load of the lift and to determine the best installation approach for your specific needs.
